intro: Rhynchosinapis cheiranthos subsp. nevadensis, commonly known as the Sierra needlepod, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, elongated pods that contain the seeds. It typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in alpine ecosystems.
